result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa K Grady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Act/Sexual Assault of Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to have no contact w/any minors except defendant's son, contact will be governed per the CHIPS order and agent approval, defendant to provide DNA Sample, defendant to have no contact w/victim or victim's family and/or victim's residence, no contact w/R.T. unless previously approved by agent, comply with all assessments, treatment, and programming deemed appropriate by DOC, comply with all directives, restrictions, and recommendations from social services as it relates to defendant's son, maintain full-time employment/schooling that is approved by agent, sign all release of information forms pertaining to offender's treatment

Transcript of March 25, 2015 Sentence Hearing filed by court reporter Catherine Thimm-Braunschweig
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

1:09 P.M., Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Nathan Otis.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received PSI, Victim's mother M.P. appearing by phone makes statement,  Atty Otis calls witness Dr. William Merrick, testimony taken, Exhibit #1, professional resume, Exhibit #2, psychosexual eval for defendant, Exhibit #3, Report by Dr. Merrick, marked by Atty Otis, moves into evidence, received, Atty Yaskal makes recommendation, Atty Otis makes recommendation, Defendant makes statement, Court in recess at 2:26 P.M., Court in session at 3:03 P.M., appearances the same, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, 7 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision, no contact w/any minors except defendant's son, contact will be governed per the CHIPS order and Agent approval, $518.00 cost, defendant to provide DNA Sample, no contact w/victim or victim's family and/or victim's residence, no contact w/R.T. unless previously approved by agent, comply with all assessments, treatment, and programming deemed appropriate by DOC, comply with all directives, restrictions, and recommendations from social services as it relates to defendant's son, maintain full-time employment/schooling that is approved by agent, sign all release of information forms pertaining to offender's treatment, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program, 4 days sentence credit, 3:23 P.M. Court in recess
six letters in support from L.G., D.R., T.P., M.G., V.S., M.G. of defendant received from Atty. Nathan Otis
and Summary of Dr. William Merrick, his Curriculum Vita received from Atty. Nathan Otis
by Probation Agent Patricia Grabow, Stevens Point office
Sentencing hearing on March 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Nathan Otis.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Yaskal state that both parties will be requesting a PSI, with fully argued sentencing to follow.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 Dismissed but read in.  PSI was ordered.

Jury trial on April 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Nathan Otis.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information previously filed, reading waived.  Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Nathan Otis.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination. Cross examination.  Closing statements.  Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Bond continued.  Information will be filed at a later date by State.  To be set for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

9:05 A.M., Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Nathan Otis.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Otis argues to dismiss the Criminal Complaint, Atty Yaskal argues w/an objection, Court in recess at 9:15 A.M. back in session at 9:30- A.M., Court denies Motion to Dismiss, 9:36 A.M.

Defendant shall have no contact with any minors except incidental, or as recommended by Health and Human Services for CHIPS case 14JC247.  Defendant may attend wedding on 7-26-14 at Black Earth, WI from 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm.  Standard felony conditions.  All other prior conditions remain.

Defendant Melissa K Grady in court with attorney Jessa K. Nicholson.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State objects to bond modification.  Court grants modification of bond to $5000.00 cash.  Defendant shall have no contact with any minors except incidental, or as recommended by Health and Human Services for CHIPS case 14JC247.  Defendant may attend wedding on 7-26-14 at Black Earth, WI from 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm.
